Events that occurred on 19 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1913 - Exeter College Smoker, featuring a cover illustration by J.R.R. Tolkien, is printed.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 141b.
1956 - The first episode of 1956 radio series of The Lord of the Rings airs on the BBC Third Programme.
1962 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 241b.
1979 - Pictures by J.R.R. Tolkien is published in the US.
2001 - Meditations on Middle-earth is published.
2007 - The Children of Húrin Signed Limited Edition is published.
2012 - The Tolkien Estate, The Tolkien Trust and HarperCollins file another lawsuit with New Line Cinema and the Saul Zaentz Company over merchandising rights.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor and Voronwë pass the Seven Gates to reach Gondolin. They are taken to Turgon who is told that they should abandon the city; Turgon decides to stay.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
Last quarter[1]

content.content: ↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p.xlviii
